validationRules.layout: Required - Must be 'grid' or 'carousel'. Grid displays all members statically, carousel creates slider
validationRules.Style: Visual style variant string (e.g., 'style-1', 'style-2', 'style-3'). Each style has unique card design
validationRules.TeamMemberR: Required array - Minimum 1 team member object required for display
validationRules.TeamMemberR[].TName: Required string - Team member's full name
validationRules.TeamMemberR[].TDesig: String - Job title or designation (e.g., 'CEO', 'Senior Developer')
validationRules.TeamMemberR[].TImage: Object with url and Id properties - Team member photo (url can be empty for placeholder)
validationRules.TeamMemberR[].MailUrl: Object - Email mailto link (url: 'mailto:email@domain.com', target, nofollow)
validationRules.TeamMemberR[].FbUrl: Object - Facebook profile URL (url, target:'_blank', nofollow)
validationRules.TeamMemberR[].WsUrl: Object - Website/social URL (LinkedIn, Twitter, GitHub, personal site, etc.)
validationRules.TeamMemberR[].CusUrl: Object - Custom URL for bio pages, contact forms, portfolio, etc.
validationRules.TeamMemberR[]._key: String - Unique key for array item (use index or unique ID)
validationRules.Alignment: Responsive object with md/sm/xs. Values: 'left', 'center', 'right' for text alignment
validationRules.target: For URL objects - Use '_blank' to open in new tab, empty string for same tab
validationRules.nofollow: For URL objects - SEO attribute, typically empty string unless intentional nofollow

warnings: ⚠️ TeamMemberR array requires minimum 1 member - empty array will display nothing
⚠️ TImage.url can be empty (shows placeholder), but object with url/Id properties required
⚠️ All social URL objects require url, target, nofollow properties (even if empty strings)
⚠️ _key is important for React rendering - use unique values (index numbers or IDs)
⚠️ Carousel layout may not work well with < 3 members (grid recommended for small teams)
⚠️ Very large TeamMemberR arrays (> 50 members) may cause performance issues in carousel mode
⚠️ TCateg is for display/filtering only - doesn't automatically filter unless plugin supports it
⚠️ WsUrl is generic 'website' field - can be used for any platform (LinkedIn, Twitter, GitHub, etc.)
⚠️ CusUrl is for additional custom links - bio pages, portfolios, contact forms, blog posts
⚠️ Facebook links should use full URL format: https://facebook.com/username
⚠️ Missing TName will cause display issues - always provide name for each member
⚠️ Image aspect ratios should be consistent across all team members for visual balance
⚠️ Target '_blank' on social links is best practice but test accessibility (screen readers)
⚠️ Empty social URL objects still render icon placeholders in some styles - omit entire object if not used
commonMistakes: ❌ Forgetting _key property in TeamMemberR array items (causes React warnings)
❌ Using incomplete URL objects (missing target or nofollow properties)
❌ Not using 'mailto:' prefix for email addresses in MailUrl
❌ Mixing portrait and landscape photo orientations (looks unbalanced)
❌ Using carousel layout for 1-2 members (grid is better for small counts)
❌ Not setting TImage.Id when using WordPress media library (breaks media management)
❌ Leaving TDesig empty (looks incomplete, provide job title or role)
❌ Using TCateg inconsistently (some members have it, others don't)
❌ Not optimizing TImage photos (large uncompressed images slow page load)
❌ Using different image sizes for team members (creates uneven grid)
❌ Putting full URLs in MailUrl instead of mailto: format
❌ Not testing responsive layout - team members may stack awkwardly on mobile
❌ Adding too many social links (clutters design, stick to 2-3 most relevant)
❌ Using CusUrl for standard social media (use specific FbUrl, WsUrl instead)
❌ Not providing alt text context for accessibility (handled via WordPress media library)
bestPractices: ✅ Use consistent image dimensions for all team members (e.g., 400x400px square headshots)
✅ Optimize images before upload - compress to < 100KB each for fast loading
✅ Provide TDesig for every member - helps users understand roles/hierarchy
✅ Use TCateg consistently for logical grouping (Executive, Design, Sales, etc.)
✅ Set target:'_blank' for social links (FbUrl, WsUrl) to keep users on your site
✅ Use grid layout for 1-8 members, carousel for 6+ members or space constraints
✅ Include at least email (MailUrl) for professional contact - most expected link
✅ Use CusUrl for bio pages, portfolios, or detailed team member pages
✅ Align centered (Alignment.md:'center') for formal/executive teams
✅ Align left (Alignment.md:'left') for large teams/directories for easier scanning
✅ Use unique _key values - index numbers ("0", "1", "2") are fine
✅ Test with placeholder images first before adding real photos
✅ Keep TDesig concise - 2-4 words max (e.g., 'CEO & Founder', not full bio)
✅ Use professional headshots with consistent background (solid color or blurred)
✅ Combine with tp-heading-title block for section header above team grid
✅ For large teams (10+), consider adding search/filter functionality via custom code
✅ Use responsive alignment: center on mobile, left on desktop for readability
✅ Limit social links to 2-3 most relevant platforms per person (avoid clutter)
✅ Use WsUrl for LinkedIn on professional teams (most business-appropriate social)
✅ Provide fallback placeholder image in theme for members without photos

grid.description: Static grid display - all members visible simultaneously
grid.pros: All members visible at once, better for SEO, no JavaScript required, easier scanning
grid.cons: Takes more vertical space, may require scrolling for large teams
grid.bestFor: Small-medium teams (1-12 members), executive teams, when all members should be prominently featured

carousel.cons: Requires user interaction, some members hidden initially, JavaScript dependency
carousel.bestFor: Large teams (6+ members), homepage team teasers, space-constrained layouts, visual interest

accessibilityNotes: ♿ Provide descriptive alt text for all TImage photos via WordPress media library
♿ Use descriptive TDesig titles that make sense without visual context
♿ Email links (MailUrl) should use 'mailto:' for screen reader compatibility
♿ External links (target:'_blank') should ideally include 'opens in new tab' indication
♿ Ensure TName uses real names, not decorative text or emojis
♿ Carousel navigation should be keyboard accessible (arrow keys work)
♿ Don't rely solely on TImage to convey important information - use text
♿ Test with screen readers to ensure team member info is announced properly
♿ Ensure sufficient color contrast for TName and TDesig text against background
♿ Provide skip navigation for very large team grids (10+ members)
performanceConsiderations: ⚡ Optimize all TImage photos - use compression tools (aim for < 100KB per photo)
⚡ Use appropriate image sizes - 400x400px or 600x600px sufficient for team member cards
⚡ Lazy load images for large team grids (WordPress handles this automatically for img tags)
⚡ Limit carousel to < 20 members for smooth animation performance
⚡ Use WebP format with JPEG fallback for best compression and browser support
⚡ Avoid excessive social links (> 4 per member) which add DOM weight
⚡ Grid layout performs better than carousel for SEO and initial render
⚡ Consider pagination or "Load More" for very large teams (20+ members)
⚡ Minimize inline styles - rely on block's CSS for consistent styling
⚡ Test carousel auto-play settings - can increase CPU usage on lower-end devices
